profile.name: Connie Fong
profile.title: SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER
profile.description: A highly accomplished and NV1-cleared Senior IAM Software Engineer with over 22 years of progressive experience at IBM Global Finance and IBM Global Marketing, specializing in designing, developing, and implementing secure identity and access management (IAM) solutions within complex enterprise Microsoft environments.  Proven expertise in architecting and delivering hybrid IAM systems, integrating authentication protocols (OAuth2, OpenID Connect, SAML), and automating lifecycle processes using PowerShell and Azure tools.  Adept at leveraging Active Directory, ADFS, Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD), and .NET for building scalable and secure enterprise applications.  Demonstrates a strong commitment to secure, compliant, and efficient access governance, consistently exceeding expectations and achieving recognition for innovative solutions.
profile.description2: Connie's extensive experience encompasses the full lifecycle of IAM projects, from initial design and architecture to implementation, deployment, and ongoing support.  She possesses a deep understanding of cloud technologies (Azure) and on-premise systems (z/OS), enabling her to seamlessly integrate and manage identities across hybrid environments.  Her expertise extends to DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipeline creation and automation using tools like UrbanCode Deploy and GitHub.  A collaborative and results-oriented leader, Connie has mentored global teams, guided development squads on IAM best practices, and consistently delivered high-impact solutions, as evidenced by her IBM CIO Award (2022) and second-place win in a global IBM Hackathon.  Her proven ability to deliver secure, scalable, and efficient IAM solutions makes her an ideal candidate for challenging roles requiring strong technical expertise and leadership skills.
